story.iWant: to integrate the existing Tailwind CSS and custom CSS into the React project
story.tasks: - [ ] **Task 1: Setup Tailwind CSS** (AC: 1) - [ ] Install and configure Tailwind CSS for the `portfolio-react-template` Vite project. - [ ] Create a `tailwind.config.js` file. - [ ] Configure the `postcss.config.js` file. - [ ] Ensure the main CSS file (`src/index.css`) imports Tailwind's base, components, and utilities. - [ ] **Task 2: Consolidate Styles** (AC: 1) - [ ] Analyze `brownfield/index.html` to identify all ``ed stylesheets and inline `

story-context.acceptanceCriteria: 1. **Given** the React components created in the previous story, **when** I view the application in the browser, **then** the styling of all components on the main page matches the original `brownfield/index.html` pixel-for-pixel. 2. **Given** the styling is applied, **when** I run a performance analysis (e.g., Lighthouse), **then** the unified styling does not negatively impact page load speed or rendering performance compared to the original static site.

doc.snippet: As a developer, I want to integrate the existing Tailwind CSS and custom CSS into the React project, so that the components are styled correctly.

constraints.constraint: All new styles should be implemented using Tailwind CSS utility classes where possible.
The final visual output must be a pixel-perfect match of `brownfield/index.html`.

tests.standards: Co-locate tests with the code they test (e.g., Component.test.tsx). Snapshot tests should be updated if styling changes alter the DOM structure.

ideas.idea: Update snapshot tests for all 8 components after styling is applied to ensure no structural regressions.
Use a visual regression testing tool (if available) to automate pixel-perfect comparison, otherwise manual verification is required.
